intro: Paphiopedilum esquirolii, commonly known as the Esquiroli’s lady's slipper, is a rare and exquisite orchid native to the mountainous regions of southern China and northern Vietnam. It is characterized by its striking, slipper-shaped pouch that is often a deep purple or violet with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, thriving in shaded, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing a unique and fragrant aroma. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is highly sought after in the horticultural trade and requires careful cultivation to ensure its survival.
